title: Create a cost allocation rule
content:
Several out-of-the-box cost allocation rules are provided out of the box. Also, you can edit or create new rules based on your business needs.

  1. From the main menu, select Run > Financials > Cost allocation. The Cost Allocation page is displayed.

  2. Click New.

  3. In the New Cost Allocation dialog box, provide all requested information. This dialog box requests values for the basic attributes.

    Field Description

    Rule type

    Type of the cost allocation rule.

    • Expense allocation 
    • Chargeback allocation

    Parent type

    		 Record type to which the cost allocation rule applies.
    For an expense allocation rule, the following record types are available:
    • Contract
    • Device
    • License
    • Infrastructure & Peripheral
    For a chargeback allocation rule, the following record types are available:
    • Subscription
    • Device
    • Infrastructure & Peripheral

    Display label

    		 External (common) name of the cost allocation rule.

    Description

    Description that captures the details of the cost allocation rule.

    Owner

    The person who owns the cost allocation rule.
    Start date Specify a date that the cost allocation rule becomes effective.
    End date Specify a date that the cost allocation rule becomes ineffective.

  4. Click Save.

    Alternatively, you can click Save & add another to add another cost allocation rule, or click Save & Edit to continue editing the current cost allocation rule.

Out-of-the-box cost allocation rules

The following table lists detailed information about the out-of-the-box cost allocation rules.

Parent type Rule type Condition Recurring Allocation tab information Description
Contract Expense allocation ${entity.PhaseId == 'Execute' && entity.RecurringCost == null} No

Expense information

Initial amount = ${entity.InitialPayment}

Currency = ${entity.Currency}

Expense date = ${entity.StartDate}

Debit

Cost center = ${entity.CostCenter}

Cost type = ${entity.CostType}

 This rule can be used to generate one-time expense lines based on the cost information on contracts.
Expense allocation ${entity.PhaseId == 'Execute' && entity.RecurringCost != null } Yes

Expense information

Initial amount = ${entity.InitialPayment}

Currency = ${entity.Currency}

Expense date = ${entity.StartDate}

Recurring amount = ${entity.RecurringCost}

Recurring period= ${entity.RecurringPeriod}

Recurring start = ${entity.StartDate}

Recurring end = ${entity.EndDate}

Debit

Cost center = ${entity.CostCenter}

Cost type = ${entity.CostType}

 This rule can be used to generate recurring time expense lines based on the cost information on contracts.
Device Expense allocation ${entity.PhaseId == 'pReceive' && entity.AcquisitionType == 'Purchase'} No

Expense information

Initial amount = ${entity.TotalAmount}

Currency = ${entity.Currency}

Expense date = ${now()}

Debit

Cost center = ${entity.CostCenter}

Cost type = ${entity.CostType}

 This rule can be used to generate expense lines for device acquisitions.
Chargeback allocation ${entity.PhaseId == 'pInUse' && entity.RecurringCost == null} No

Expense information

Initial amount = ${entity.InitialCost}

Currency = ${entity.ChargebackCurrency}

Expense date = ${now()}

Debit

Cost center = ${entity.OwnedByPerson.CostCenter}

Cost type = ${entity.CostType}

Credit

Cost center = ${entity.CostCenter}

Cost type = ${entity.CostType}

 This rule can be used to generate expense lines based on chargeback for device assignments with one-time costs.
Chargeback allocation ${entity.PhaseId == 'pInUse' && entity.RecurringCost != null} Yes

Expense information

Initial amount = ${entity.InitialCost}

Currency = ${entity.ChargebackCurrency}

Expense date = ${now()}

Recurring amount = ${entity.RecurringCost}

Recurring period= ${entity.RecurringPeriod}

Recurring start = ${now()}

Recurring end = null

Debit

Cost center = ${entity.OwnedByPerson.CostCenter}

Cost type = ${entity.CostType}

Credit

Cost center = ${entity.CostCenter}

Cost type = ${entity.CostType}

 This rule can be used to generate expense lines based on chargeback for device assignments with recurring costs.
Infrastructure & Peripheral Expense allocation ${entity.PhaseId == 'pReceive' && entity.AcquisitionType == 'Purchase'} No

Expense information

Initial amount = ${entity.TotalAmount}

Currency = ${entity.Currency}

Expense date = ${now()}

Debit

Cost center = ${entity.CostCenter}

Cost type = ${entity.CostType}

 This rule can be used to generate expense lines for Infrastructure & Peripheral acquisitions.
Chargeback allocation ${entity.PhaseId == 'pInUse' && entity.RecurringCost == null} No

Expense information

Initial amount = ${entity.InitialCost}

Currency = ${entity.ChargebackCurrency}

Expense date = ${now()}

Debit

Cost center = ${entity.OwnedByPerson.CostCenter}

Cost type = ${entity.CostType}

Credit

Cost center = ${entity.CostCenter}

Cost type = ${entity.CostType}

 This rule can be used to generate expense lines based on chargeback for Infrastructure & Peripheral assignments with one-time costs.
Chargeback allocation ${entity.PhaseId == 'pInUse' && entity.RecurringCost != null} Yes

Expense information

Initial amount = ${entity.InitialCost}

Currency = ${entity.ChargebackCurrency}

Expense date = ${now()}

Recurring amount = ${entity.RecurringCost}

Recurring period= ${entity.RecurringPeriod}

Recurring start = ${now()}

Recurring end = null

Debit

Cost center = ${entity.OwnedByPerson.CostCenter}

Cost type = ${entity.CostType}

Credit

Cost center = ${entity.CostCenter}

Cost type = ${entity.CostType}

 This rule can be used to generate expense lines based on chargeback for Infrastructure & Peripheral assignments with recurring costs.
License Expense allocation ${entity.PhaseId == 'pReceive' && entity.AcquisitionType == 'Purchase'} No

Expense information

Initial amount = ${entity.TotalAmount}

Currency = ${entity.Currency}

Expense date = ${now()}

Debit

Cost center = ${entity.CostCenter}

Cost type = ${entity.CostType}

 This rule can be used to generate expense lines for license acquisitions.
Subscription Chargeback allocation ${entity.Status =='Active' && entity.RecurringCost == null && entity.InitiatedByOffering != null} No

Expense information

Initial amount = ${entity.FrontCost}

Currency = ${entity.CostCurrency}

Expense date = ${now()}

Debit

Cost center = ${entity.Subscriber.CostCenter}

Cost type = ${entity.InitiatedByOffering.CostType}

Credit

Cost center = ${entity.InitiatedByOffering.CostCenter}

Cost type = ${entity.InitiatedByOffering.CostType}

 This rule can be used to generate one-time expense lines for subscriptions.
Chargeback allocation ${entity.Status =='Active' && entity.RecurringCost != null && entity.InitiatedByOffering != null} Yes

Expense information

Initial amount = ${entity.FrontCost}

Currency = ${entity.CostCurrency}

Expense date = ${now()}

Recurring amount = ${entity.RecurringCost}

Recurring period= ${entity.RecurringPeriod}

Recurring start = ${entity.StartDate}

Recurring end = ${entity.EndDate}

Debit

Cost center = ${entity.Subscriber.CostCenter}

Cost type = ${entity.InitiatedByOffering.CostType}

Credit

Cost center = ${entity.InitiatedByOffering.CostCenter}

Cost type = ${entity.InitiatedByOffering.CostType}

 This rule can be used to generate expense lines for the subscriptions with recurring costs.
